The plant produces yellow flowers in globular clusters, which are followed by flat, leathery pods containing seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. The silky acacia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally for various purposes, including medicine and basket weaving.
